biasRandomWalkAlgo

Class biasRandomWalk

  • java.lang.Object
    • biasRandomWalkAlgo.biasRandomWalk

  • public class biasRandomWalk
extends java.lang.Object
    The class biasRandomWalk implements the Biased Random Walks to identify Prominent Actor in Online Social Networks Based on the article: "Frank Takes, Walter Kosters, Leiden University, The Netherlands"
    Since:
    08/09/2014
    Author:
    axm1064 ID: 1402590
    See Also:
    Identifying Prominent Actors in Online Social Networks using Biased Random Walks, Frank Takes, Walter Kosters, Leiden University, The Netherlands

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      biasRandomWalk(java.lang.String strInput, int nbrIter, int nbrPromNodes, double prob, double alpha)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String brwToJson()
      The brwToJson() method creates a String JSON Object containing the information requested by the user/client (results of the algorithm).
      java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> find(java.lang.String str, java.lang.String key)
      The find method retrieves all the value associated with the key parameter input.
      void printSortedNodes()
      The printSortedNodes() method is a useful print function used for debug and testing.
      void runBiasRandWalk()
      The runBiasRandWalk() method simply implements the BRW algorithm with the parameter of the user (N, P, Alpha) Each node is assigned a score ( a kind of counter incremented by 1/NumberOfNodes once the node is hit)
      void runRandWalk()
      Not really used/ wanted to implement a pure Random Walk Which could be retrieved by simply changing the value of alpha.
      void setNewGraphData(java.lang.String jsonText)
      Setter The method setNewGraphData sets a new JSON Text Object (Network)

    • Constructor Detail

      • biasRandomWalk

        public biasRandomWalk(java.lang.String strInput,
              int nbrIter,
              int nbrPromNodes,
              double prob,
              double alpha)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        strInput - String JSON Object / Networks Graph input
        nbrIter - Number of iteration N >= 10 or 100 x number of nodes
        nbrPromNodes - int Number of Prominent nodes to retrieve
        prob - double Probability p jump probability to a completely random node. (1-p) probability of selecting a node in the neighbourhood with the bias function.
        alpha - double used to define the focus on either the neighbourhood density or the degree centrality.

    • Method Detail

      • printSortedNodes

        public void printSortedNodes()
        The printSortedNodes() method is a useful print function used for debug and testing. Basically, It prints the list of nodes, in order.

      • setNewGraphData

        public void setNewGraphData(java.lang.String jsonText)
        Setter The method setNewGraphData sets a new JSON Text Object (Network)
        Parameters:
        jsonText -

      • runBiasRandWalk

        public void runBiasRandWalk()
        The runBiasRandWalk() method simply implements the BRW algorithm with the parameter of the user (N, P, Alpha) Each node is assigned a score ( a kind of counter incremented by 1/NumberOfNodes once the node is hit)

      • runRandWalk

        public void runRandWalk()
        Not really used/ wanted to implement a pure Random Walk Which could be retrieved by simply changing the value of alpha. Pure Random walk without any bias

      • brwToJson

        public java.lang.String brwToJson()
        The brwToJson() method creates a String JSON Object containing the information requested by the user/client (results of the algorithm).
        Returns:
        String JSON object to be exported through the network to the user. Object type exchanged between the user and the server.

      • find

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> find(java.lang.String str,
                                          java.lang.String key)
        The find method retrieves all the value associated with the key parameter input.
        Parameters:
        str - String JSON object
        key - to search in the input string, and retrieve the value associated. (key/value pair JavaScript Object notation)
        Returns:
        LinkedList object containing
